23.fullDescription:
In the function `setReward()` a non-zero amount of Ether is sent to an address taken from storage slot 0.
There is a check on storage index 0. This storage slot can be written to by calling the function `claimReward(uint256)`.

There is a check on storage index 0. This storage slot can be written to by calling the function `claimReward(uint256)`.
There is a check on storage index 0. This storage slot can be written to by calling the function `claimReward(uint256)`.
23.name: AccessControlVulnerability

23.fullDescription: A possible transaction order independence vulnerability exists in function setReward(). The value or direction of the call statement is determined from a tainted storage location
23.name: FrontRunningVulnerability
